lot.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: a group of people or things considered together
lot.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: Could you help me carry this lot upstairs?
Come on, you lot, hurry up!
His friends are a strange lot.
The last lot of people offered £70,000.
I did three lots of exams last summer.
lot.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: your lot is your work, duties, social position etc, especially when they could be better
lot.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: She seems happy enough with her lot.
The unions have always tried to improve the lot of their members.
lot.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: an area of land used for building on or for another purpose
lot.translation[1].definitions[2].exampl: the vacant lot (=empty land) behind the Commercial Hotel
lot.translation[1].definitions[3].defini: a building and the land surrounding it where films are made
lot.translation[1].definitions[4].defini: something, or a group of things, that is sold at an auction
lot.translation[1].definitions[5].defini: if someone is chosen by lot, several people each take a piece of paper or an object from a container, and the person who is chosen is the one who gets a particular marked paper or object
lot.translation[1].definitions[5].exampl: In Athens at that time, judges were chosen by lot.
lot.translation[1].definitions[6].defini: to choose something or someone by lot
lot.translation[1].definitions[6].exampl: We drew lots to decide who should go first.
lot.translation[3].definitions[0].defini: something that is sold at an AUCTION, especially a group of things that are sold together
lot.translation[3].definitions[0].exampl: The auction was a record sell-out, with all but two of 111 lots sold for a total of £6.3 million.
lot.translation[3].definitions[1].defini: a group of shares that are sold together
lot.translation[3].definitions[2].defini: a quantity of goods that is produced at the same time or sold together as a group
lot.translation[3].definitions[2].exampl: Batch production is the production of standardised units in small or large lots.
lot.translation[3].definitions[3].defini: an area of land, especially one used for building on
